description: Creates a new Amazon EMR Studio.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: A descriptive name for the Amazon EMR Studio.

parameters.name: AuthMode
parameters.description: Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using IAM or IAM Identity Center.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The ID of the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) to associate with the Studio.

parameters.name: SubnetIds
parameters.description: A list of subnet IDs to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. A Studio can have a maximum of 5 subnets. The subnets must belong to the VPC specified by VpcId. Studio users can create a Workspace in any of the specified subnets. (string) ---

parameters.name: ServiceRole
parameters.description: The IAM role that the Amazon EMR Studio assumes. The service role provides a way for Amazon EMR Studio to interoperate with other Amazon Web Services services.

parameters.name: WorkspaceSecurityGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Workspace security group. The Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic to resources in the Engine security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified by VpcId.

parameters.name: EngineSecurityGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Engine security group. The Engine security group allows inbound network traffic from the Workspace security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified by VpcId.

parameters.name: DefaultS3Location
parameters.description: The Amazon S3 location to back up Amazon EMR Studio Workspaces and notebook files.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A list of tags to associate with the Amazon EMR Studio. Tags are user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string with a maximum of 128 characters, and an optional value string with a maximum of 256 characters. (dict) --- A key-value pair containing user-defined metadata that you can associate with an Amazon EMR resource. Tags make it easier to associate clusters in various ways, such as grouping clusters to track your Amazon EMR resource allocation costs. For more information, see Tag Clusters. Key (string) --- A user-defined key, which is the minimum required information for a valid tag. For more information, see Tag. Value (string) --- A user-defined value, which is optional in a tag. For more information, see Tag Clusters.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: A user-defined key, which is the minimum required information for a valid tag. For more information, see Tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: A user-defined value, which is optional in a tag. For more information, see Tag Clusters.

nested_items.name: StudioId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio.
